result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

1:28 PM Defendant Taylor W. Bryant in court with attorney Nick Smith appearing specially.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.   Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Taylor W. Bryant
Current: W6726 Apple Avenue, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 304 S. Main Street, Apt. E, Medford, WI 54451

1:32 PM Defendant Taylor W. Bryant in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised DE of charges and penalties and waives reading of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to attorney. Defendant indicated that he will be contacting his attorney from his other cases to represent him in this case.   Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:15a.m. Mark Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $750.00 cash bond with conditions of: having no contact with S.L.S dob-11/18/1996.  Court ordered bond with conditions of going to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department for booking procedures and having no contact with S.L.S dob-11/18/1996. Initial appearance set for September 20, 2022 at 1:30p.m. -JN

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with S.L.S. - dob:  111/18/1996.
